Datasets used¶

SingletCode was tested on datasets with many different barcoding techniques, cell types and sequencing methods. Comprehensive details about the datasets used are in this page.

Datasets¶

Yes, primers are used to identify barcode region and cell ID region to amplify separately

searching for sequences complementary to the side reaction library preparation primers, filtering out reads that lack the GFP barcode sequence, have too many repeated nucleotides, or do not meet a phred score cut-off

Yes and the minimum number of reads is used as a cutoff

Starcode based on Levenshtein distance (cutoff based on manual inspection)

stringent gene count cutoff per cell, any cell having more than 1 barcode is removed

SPLINTR

60

3 library sizes - 2 × 10e5, 8 × 10e5 and 1.2 × 10e6

They can be separately sequenced and the Barcode is identified from the barcode based on the sequences flanking the barcode and then filtered based on some metrics: correct upstream constant region, PHRED score > 30 average, did not contain N residues, had expected barcode pattern - then it was mapped to SPLINTR reference library with 2 mismatches

No (it is captured along with scRNAseq)

Filtered to remove cells with <500 genes, <1000 UMIs, >15% mitichondrial gene content

The barcodes are identified based on the sequences flanking it, have correct upstream sequence, had correct pattern, did not have NN sequences, have PHRED quality >30 all over the barcode, mapped to the reference index upto 2 mismatches

Yes they are collapsed into 1

Starcode was used for creating a list of barcodes in library but not otherwsie

Yes, based on hashtag oligo combinations with the HTODemux function. Also, droplets containing a combination of two or more SPLINTR barcodes not observed in any other cell were considered to be doublets and were removed.

Watermelon

5,472,944 unique lineage barcodes detected in the Watermelon library

Yes,the whole transciptome obtained is amplified, targetted lbraries are gel separated and then amplified

Yes

Cells should have between 1000-4200 genes, less than 10% mitichondrial gene content

Need to have the necessary barcode pattern, the length should be exactly 30 and the cell IDs containing these barcodes must be seen in 10X data also

Yes, they are collapsed by using only unique entries of CellID-Barcode_UMI sequence

Yes, they have a method: 1) Count number of UMIs supporting each barcode 2) Find the edit distance to the most common barcodes for all lineage barcodes 3)If edit distance is less than 3, add the UMIs of this barcode to the most common barcode and remove this entry 4) If a barcode associated with the cell had UMI count less than 3 times the UMI count of the barcode with max UMI count, this barcode was removed

The cDNA obtained during 10X sequencing is amplified; after scATAC seq, it is amplified using primers

Low-quality cells with high mitochondrial reads, low UMIs and features per cell were removed,

Cells with 1-25 barcodes are kept. Cell ID- CellTag - UMI supported by just 1 read are removed

10X, Drop-Seq

ClonMapper

20

~7.6 * 10e7 unique barcodes

Yes, it was done for both pre- and post-treated cells

No, it was directly read from the BAM file after CellRanger with no amplification step

Minimum transcript counts - 4000, percentage content of mitochondrial genes - 8%, minimum number of genes sequenced - 750 (the exact values depends on dataset)

The 3’ and 5’ adapters flanking the barcode are used to identify the region, minimum - 3’ adapter + 10 bp barcode sequence. Also, for gDNA sequenced barcodes, singleton barcodes that were not clustered in Starcode were discarded.

For barcode reads less than 20, all barcode reads within the cell were compared. If an exact match was found for the 3’ end of a longer barcode, this read was extended. These corrected barcodes were omitted if they were absent in the list of known clones in TP0. The UMI-replicate reads were resolved by using the most frequent barcode read for each cell if none of the other barcodes in the cell had a count greater than 50% of the most frequent barcode. If this was not true, the clonal reads were all removed from the cell

Yes for gDNA sequencing of cells, starcode is used implementing a message-passing algorithm with a maximum Levenshtein distance of 1 and minimum radius size of 3.
